newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Telebras rises, ADRs steady.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Telebras rises, ADRs steady.

text.p: Brazilian telephone company Telebras SA rose on Tuesday as foreign companies' American Depositary Receipts ADRs steadied with the rest of the New York markets.

Traders said the ADRs were helped by data from the National Association of Purchasing Managers that showed its key price component dropped in March from February. The figures helped boost the U.S. Treasury 30-year bond.
"Net-net, we're seeing stability in the stocks on the back of a steady bond market," said Val Kosmider, head of international equity trading at Schroder Wertheim.
"Things are leveling out to prices that are reflected in the (companies' home) market. They are stable to slightly higher."

Telebras rose 1-3/8 to 103-3/4 in moderate volume and was among the most-active ADRs in midday trade. The ADRs were helped by optimism about the scheduled April 7 auction of privatized cellular telephone bands and by a rebound from recent selling of the ADRs.
Other Latin American telecommunications companies, considered high-profile proxies for regional stocks as a whole, also steadied. Telefonos de Mexico unchanged at 389-1/2 in moderate volume.
"We're still a little nervous and still waiting for quarterly results," a Latin American trader said.
British drugs company SmithKline Beecham Plc rose 1-3/8 to 71-3/8 after "being hammered in recent days from a stronger dollar," a trader said.
Britain's Glaxo Wellcome Plc also rose 7/8 to 36-1/4.
Decliners led advancers 279 to 203 among 806 ADRs. The ADR index was down 0.15 percent at midday and volume was 38 million shares.
